result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony T Morris in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony T Morris is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony T Morris

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony T Morris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Anthony T Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fred Richardson III recently appointed. State indicates that defendant is being held federally and moves to dismiss this case, no objection from defense. Court orders case DISMISSED without prejudice.

Defendant Anthony T Morris in court, appear by video with attorney Michael J Cerniglia, appear by video.  Defendant Anthony T Morris in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with AVS (d.o.b. 2/16/02),; Chase Bank 7606 W. Morgan Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53219
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony T Morris in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Anthony T Morris in custody at MSDF.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony T Morris appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1, a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
